greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of positive solutions to "numbers that are n times their number of binary 1's".
comment: Equivalently, this is the number of ways to write n as an arithmetic mean of distinct powers of 2. [_Brian Kell_, Mar 01 2009]
link: Peter Kagey, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
maple: N:= 1000: # to get a(1) to a(N)
for x from 1 while x/(1+ilog2(x)) <= N do
if v::integer and v <= N then
# x must have bdgs bits set, so x =bdgs*n >= 2^bdgs-1.
results.author: _Henry Bottomley_, Nov 23 2001
